enigmatica6.ponder.laser_drill.introduct: How to use the Laser Drill
enigmatica6.ponder.tag.industrial_forego: Learn more about the Industrial Foregoing mod and its various intriguing mechanics!
enigmatica6.ponder.laser_drill.ether_gas: Say Hi to the camera, Bartholomew!
enigmatica6.ponder.latex.extracting_flui: To get started, you need to place a Fluid Extractor against a log of wood, such as Acacia.
enigmatica6.ponder.laser_drill.ether_gas: Next, we will need a willing test subject. Luckily, I know just the right one for this job!
enigmatica6.ponder.latex.extracting_flui: Latex is a renewable resource gathered from trees, and plays a vital role in Industrial Foregoing.
enigmatica6.ponder.laser_drill.ether_gas: Trust me when I say: You DO NOT want to let this thing run out of power for this build.
enigmatica6.ponder.latex.processing_late: This is quite a slow process; you'll have to wait around 5 seconds for each Tiny Dry Rubber...
enigmatica6.ponder.laser_drill.ether_gas: Next, we need to place down a stasis chamber. This puppy, when provided with power, will prevent any entities within its working area (blue), including players, from moving or interacting with the world in any way, hence the name.
enigmatica6.ponder.latex.extracting_flui: Keep in mind that using different logs with the Fluid Extractor may give you different fluids!
enigmatica6.ponder.latex.processing_late: It'll start coalescing the Latex fluid into tiny balls of rubber!
enigmatica6.ponder.laser_drill.ether_gas: First, we have our typical Fluid Laser Drill setup, with the Laser Base containing a Purple Lens. I've also left out the energy input here because you should know that the Drills need energy by now.
enigmatica6.ponder.latex.extracting_flui: Be sure to check JEI for more information on what kinds of fluids you can extract at what rate from different blocks!
enigmatica6.ponder.latex.processing_late: To get large piles of Dry Rubber...
enigmatica6.ponder.laser_drill.ether_gas: Welcome... to the Wither Milker (patent pending)! You'll see why it's called that in a bit, but for now, let's go over the individual parts.
enigmatica6.ponder.latex.processing_late: Once you have some Tiny Dry Rubber, you can then process it further...
So, now that you have a bunch of Latex, the question becomes: What do you do with it?
enigmatica6.ponder.laser_drill.lenses.he: Using Lenses to improve your chances
enigmatica6.ponder.laser_drill.fluid_dri: For example, if you place it in any Nether biome...
Fundamentally, the Fluid Laser is quite similar to its Ore counterpart, but it requires a Lens to function, and different recipes can have special requirements you may have to watch out for.
They serve as the "focus" for the Fluid Laser.
In addition to increasing your odds with the Ore Laser, Lenses serve another important purpose:
enigmatica6.ponder.latex.processing_late: Processing Latex into Rubber and Plastic
enigmatica6.ponder.laser_drill.fluid_dri: Other, more "involved" requirements exist as well, and we'll touch on my personal favourite in this next and final scene.
Using Lenses in the Fluid Laser
enigmatica6.ponder.laser_drill.ether_gas: And that's about it for the basics of the Industrial Foregoing Laser Drill! There's more stuff we haven't covered in this tutorial, so we recommend you just give it a try yourself!
This will produce Ether Gas, which we will just stow away in a Black Hole Tank for now.
Now that dear Bartholomew over here is trapped by the Stasis Chamber and cannot wreck our stuff, we can use the Fluid Laser to... milk him. (Seriously, Buuz? This is a kids' game!)
enigmatica6.ponder.laser_drill.introduct: To construct it, you'll first need either an Ore Laser Base or a Fluid Laser Base. We'll go over the Ore Laser first.
enigmatica6.ponder.laser_drill.lenses.te: For example, if we wanted more Uranium or Emerald Ore, we could add a lime lens to the Laser...
enigmatica6.ponder.laser_drill.introduct: The Laser Drill is a mid- to late-game structure in Industrial Foregoing that lets you mine up various different resources from the void.
enigmatica6.ponder.laser_drill.lenses.te: As you could see, the resources the Ore Laser drills up are random, so how can we make sure we actually get our precious rare ores rather than ten different kinds of copper?
That's what lenses are for: By adding them into the Ore Laser Base, we can skew the odds of getting ores that have a certain colour in our favour.
enigmatica6.ponder.laser_drill.introduct: The more drills you add, the faster the Laser is going to be
..oh, and don't forget to power them!
Next, add some Laser Drills within a 2-block radius around the Base to start powering it, for example like this:
